column4: anyone here know how to unjam a module jammed by a defunct process without rebooting?

defunct processes are unkillable by any ,ethod. and apparently normally harmless. i have found though that when a process dies while using a usb device like a webcam or joystick it will jam said device and it's related modules making it unavailable to any other programme and the modules dont respond to a modprobe -r

as i said the defunct process is unkillable. for example if i am using dosbox and dosbox crashes so i kill it manually the process never dissappears from the ps-A or top list it just becomes listed as <defunct> but still somehow retains control of the frigging joystick
how are you trying to kill  it?
i have tried console within top from a root login on alt ctrl f1
none of the easy solutions work believe me i banged my head against this issue for 2 weeks when i still had faint hopes of using a webcam
you might have to sudo killall?
processes listed as defunct are already considered dead by the system. technically they arent supposed to use any resources of the system
i just hit on a very bad bug is all
Congragulations! No, don't re-install, that is a Windows solution!
LOL funny i been running ubuntu for a while now 2 or 3 years
You found a bug, now work on fixing it.
would if i could but i dont have the coding expertise heh
